problems.stem: A truss is cut through 3 members. The vertical equilibrium of the left section requires the vertical component of a diagonal member to balance a 500 N reaction. If the diagonal makes 45° with horizontal, find the total force in that diagonal member.
When using the method of sections, why is it advantageous to take moments about a point where two unknown forces intersect?
problems.expected_answer: Taking moments about this point eliminates both unknown forces from the moment equation, leaving only one unknown that can be solved directly.
